content.raw:
Brian,

Thanks for looking at this. You should be able to build both nvidia and non-nvidia images on any machine.

I’m glad you caught that mistake. Since we’re using the variables at build-time I think it’s better to use ARG than ENV. I changed this in 0685531.

Also, I think we no longer need the docker/vrx directory, so I’m removing it. This makes it less likely that users will confuse the directory name with the image names when following the tutorial.

Your summary of the current state of the build and run scripts in the tutorial is correct, but it will be out of date once the changes above are committed. I will update it.

Another note about the tutorial: I think the instructions would be much simpler if we just have the user clone the repository. A little more data has to be pulled, but fewer commands are needed. What do you think?

Finally, I noticed that the command 

`apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://ha.pool.sks-keyservers.net:80 --recv-key 421C365BD9FF1F717815A3895523BAEEB01FA116`

sometimes fails with a “keyserver receive failed” error. Then, later, it works fine. This causes the Dockerfile to die on step 7. I will add a note to the tutorial that says “if this happens, wait and try again.” If you have a better solution though please let me know.

Michael
